inbox.subject: Carnival party invitations!
inbox.body:
Certain internet providers exploit the fact that fill text cannot be recognized.
Regards,
J.

inbox.subject: Feedback on the recent updates
inbox.body: Its words and letters have been changed by addition or removal, so to deliberately render its content nonsensical; it's not genuine, correct, or comprehensible Latin anymore.

inbox.subject: First quarter budget
inbox.body:
In a professional context it often happens that private or corporate clients corder a publication to be made and presented with the actual content still not being ready. Think of a news blog that's filled with content hourly on the day of going live.
Regards,
J.

inbox.subject: Flight details
inbox.body: This might also explain why one can now find slightly different versions.

sent.subject: First quarter budget
sent.body:
One may speculate that over the course of time certain letters were added or deleted at various positions within the text.
Sincerly,
John Schaffer

drafts.subject: (No Subject)
drafts.body:
One may speculate that over the course of time certain letters were added or deleted at various positions within the text.
Sincerly,
John Schaffer

drafts.subject: (No Subject)
drafts.body: The spread of computers and layout programmes thus made dummy text better known. While in earlier times several lines are likely to focus on the text, disregarding the layout and its elements.
